core

Class Init

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.Init

  • public class Init
extends java.lang.Object
    Init.java --- Class used for the initialization of the most important instances.
    Author:
    P H - 18.03.2017

      • init

        public static boolean init(bwapi.Mirror mirror,
                           InformationStorage informationStorage)
        Function for initializing all important Functions in the beginning.
        Parameters:
        mirror - the mirror of the game.
        Returns:
        true or false depending if the action as successful or not.

      • extractMineralBlockedChokePoints

        private static void extractMineralBlockedChokePoints(bwapi.Game game,
                                                     InformationStorage informationStorage)
        Function for extracting all ChokePoints on the current map that are being blocked by minerals and therefore can not be traversed.
        Parameters:
        game - the game instance from which the initial mineral positions are being taken.
        informationStorage - the location the blocked ChokePoints are being stored in.

      • generateReversedRegionAccessOrder

        private static java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,bwta.Region> generateReversedRegionAccessOrder(bwta.Region startRegion)
        Function for generating the reversed access order of all Regions of the currently played map. Each entry contains a Region as a key and another one which is the Region a Unit would have to move to to continue moving towards the provided Region. The provided one has a value of null in the HashMap since it has no previous Region.
        • Key: Any Region of the currently played map.
        • Value: An adjacent Region which leads towards the provided one. If the key is the provided Region, the value is null.
        Parameters:
        startRegion - the Region that all other Regions must lead to.
        Returns:
        a HashMap containing Regions mapped to another adjacent one which leads towards the provided start Region.

      • generateRegionAccessOrder

        private static java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,java.util.HashSet<bwta.Region>> generateRegionAccessOrder(bwta.Region startRegion)
        Function for generating the order in which the different Regions are accessible beginning at a provided starting Region.
        • Key: Any Region of the currently played map.
        • Value: An HashSet of adjacent Regions that can be accessed by the key Region.
        Parameters:
        startRegion - the Region the access order starts at.
        Returns:
        a HashMap containing the breadth search equivalent of the access order of the different map Regions.

      • generateReversedRegionAccessOrders

        private static java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,bwta.Region>> generateReversedRegionAccessOrders(java.util.Set<bwta.Region> regions)
        Function for generating the reversed Region access orders for each Region inside the provided Set.
        • Key: Any Region of the provided Set.
        • Value: The reversed Region access order for it in form of a HashMap.
        Parameters:
        regions - the Set of Regions which the reversed access orders are generated for.
        Returns:
        a HashMap containing all reversed Region access orders for the provided Set of Regions.
        See Also:
        generateReversedRegionAccessOrder(Region)

      • generateRegionAccessOrders

        private static java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,java.util.HashSet<bwta.Region>>> generateRegionAccessOrders(java.util.Set<bwta.Region> regions)
        Function for generating the region access order for each provided Region.
        • Key: Any Region of the provided Set.
        • Value: The region access order for it in form of a HashMap.
        Parameters:
        regions - the Set of Regions which the access orders are generated for.
        Returns:
        a HashMap containing all region access orders for the provided Set of Regions.
        See Also:
        generateRegionAccessOrder(Region)

      • generateRegionDistances

        private static java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,java.util.HashSet<DistantRegion>> generateRegionDistances(java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,java.util.HashSet<bwta.Region>>> regionAccessOrders,
                                                                                                       java.util.Set<bwta.Region> regions)
        Function for generating all DistantRegion instances for a Set of provided Regions. These Regions must be part of the Region access orders, which hold their specific access orders. The result is a HashMap with following content:
        • Key: A Region.
        • Value: The DistantRegion instances that are based on the key Region.
        Parameters:
        regionAccessOrders - the Region access orders for each Region of the provided Set.
        regions - the Regions for which the DistantRegion instances are being generated.
        Returns:
        a HashMap containing different HashSets of DistantRegion instances that are based on the provided Region instances.

      • generateRegionDistances

        private static java.util.HashSet<DistantRegion> generateRegionDistances(java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,java.util.HashSet<bwta.Region>> regionAccessOrder,
                                                                        bwta.Region startRegion)
        Function for generating the DistantRegion instances based on a provided starting Region. All distances are centered around this instance while the order in which they are accessed is based on a provided Region access order.
        Parameters:
        regionAccessOrder - the order in which the different Regions are accessed, beginning with the provided starting Region.
        startRegion - the Region which the distance calculations are centered around. Must be a key in the provided Region access order.
        Returns:
        a HashSet containing all DistantRegion instances based on the provided starting Region. Latter is also part of the HashSet with a distance of 0.

      • generateRegionTilePositions

        private static java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,java.util.HashSet<bwapi.TilePosition>> generateRegionTilePositions()
                                                                                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Function for generating a HashMap containing the different Region of the current map as keys and their contained TilePositions as values:
      • Key: A Region.
      • Value: The TilePositions that are inside the Region..
Returns:
a HashMap containing the Regions and their TilePositions.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - an Exception is thrown when the TilePositions of a Region could not be generated.

  • convertBWTAPolygons

    private static void convertBWTAPolygons(InformationStorage informationStorage)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
    Function for converting the BWTA-Polygon map boundaries into standard Polygons that can be used for pathfinding etc.
    Parameters:
    informationStorage - the location the newly generated Polygons are stored in.
    Throws:
    java.lang.Exception - an Exception is thrown when the Regions of the map could not be converted into Polygons.

  • getConvertedRegionInstances

    private static java.util.List<bwta.Region> getConvertedRegionInstances()
                                                                throws java.lang.Exception
    Function for generating the "correct" BWTA Region references for all existing map Regions. The references are the ones obtained by the .getRegion() function.
    Returns:
    a List containing all "correct" BWTA Region instances.
    Throws:
    java.lang.Exception - an Exception is thrown when a Region instance could not be converted to the "correct" one or got added twice to the Collection.
